intro: Potentilla anglica subsp. nesogenes, commonly known as English cinquefoil, is a perennial shrub native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a serrated edge, often with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland, grasslands, and along roadsides.
